pt.runtime

Class TaskpoolMixedScheduling

  • java.lang.Object
    • pt.runtime.AbstractTaskPool
      • pt.runtime.TaskpoolMixedScheduling
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Taskpool

    public class TaskpoolMixedScheduling
extends AbstractTaskPool
    The mixed scheduling policy is a combination of Work Stealing and Work Sharing policies, such that when enqueuing a task, if the enqueuing thread is a worker thread, the Work Stealing policy is used, and if the enqueuing thread is a non-worker thread, the Work Sharing policy is used!

    A worker thread potentially prefers to execute tasks from its own localOneOffTask queue before helping with the global shared queue!
    Since:
    14/9/2014
    Author:
    Mostafa Mehrabi

    • Method Detail

      • enqueueReadyTask

        protected void enqueueReadyTask(TaskID<?> taskID)
        When enqueuing tasks under the Mixed Scheduling policy, if a task cannot be executed by arbitrary threads, it will be enqueued to the privateQueue of the thread in charge of executing it.

        However, if the task can be executed by arbitrary threads it will be enqueued to the mixedMultiTask queue if it is a TaskIDGroup, otherwise it will be enqueued to the mixedOneOffTask queue.
        Specified by:
        enqueueReadyTask in class AbstractTaskPool
        Since:
        14/9/2014

      • workerPollNextTask

        public TaskID<?> workerPollNextTask()
        This method polls a new task for the current thread that is requesting for a new task under the Mixed Scheduling policy. This method should only be called by Worker Threads.

        Once a worker thread requests for a new task, this method checks if the thread is a Multi Task thread. If so, then the privateQueue of that thread will be checked. In case there is a task found which passes the preliminary execution attempt successfully, the task is passed to the thread to execute.

        However, if the private queue of the Multi Task worker thread does not have any executable tasks, then the method will check the mixedMultiTask queue. Every multi-task in this queue will be expanded into its sub-tasks, and the sub-tasks will be enqueue as ready-to-execute tasks, but the thread will temporarily return without a task for this time, waiting for later chances.

        If the current worker thread is not a Multi Task worker thread, then the method checks the mixedOneOffTask queue. For a given task inside this queue, if the thread is allowed to execute it, the task will be checked with preliminary execution attempt. If the attempt is successful, the task will be sent to thread to execute. However, if the thread is not allowed to execute the task, the task will be enqueued to the privateQueue of the thread in charge of executing it.This process will continue until either a task is found for the thread, or all tasks inside the mixedOneOffTask queue are polled and enqueued into privateQueues.
        Specified by:
        workerPollNextTask in interface Taskpool
        Specified by:
        workerPollNextTask in class AbstractTaskPool
        Returns:
        Since:
        14/9/2014
